bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to Josiah Quincy, March 31, 1893
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 22. Consulate-General U.S.A., Monrovia, Liberia, March 31, 1893.
Mr. William D. McCoy, to the Department of State.
No. 22. Consulate-General, U.S.A., Monrovia, Liberia, March 31, 1893.
Honorable Assistant Secretary of State, WASHINGTON, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor of submitting the inclosed Reports for the Quarter ending this date.

1. Summary of business 2. Digest of the Invoice Book 3. Arrival and Departures of vessels 4. Record of notarial Service 5. ,, ,, Treasury Fees received 6. Salary Account 7. Contingent Expense Account 8. Register
8. Register of Letters sent 9. Abstract of Expenses 10. Vouchers for Expenditures
